titles.title: Kaitou Joker
Mysterious Joker
怪盗ジョーカー Mysterious Joker
Joker
怪盗Joker

anime.description: There is nothing that cannot be stolen by http://anidb.net/ch68837 [Joker], the Mysterious Thief. Joker goes around the world, using his tricks to steal all forms of treasure. The authorities use all methods available in order to subdue him, ranging from deploying special agents to using the most sophisticated equipment, but never to any avail. Can nothing stop the Mysterious Thief? Source: Mangaupdates

tag.name: shounen
tag.description: In the context of manga and associated media, shounen, literally meaning "youth" and often also specifically "boy", refers to a male audience roughly between the ages of 10 and 18. Source: Wikipedia

tag.name: target audience
tag.description: Anime, like everything else in the modern world, is targeted towards specific audiences, both implicitly by the creators and overtly by the marketing. While categories are associated with specific sex and age groups, this is not a bar on the anime being enjoyed by people who don`t fit into that band; not only do crossover titles exist, but the categories also have a considerable following outside their main demographic, and a person might as well enjoy anime from all categories. Still, does not invalidate the usefulness of marking a title as one of the categories; the same themes will likely be treated differently in anime geared for different audiences. Only one should not jump the gun and assume that a title will be more or less serious or present content in this or that way due to its target audience, or conversely assume the target audience on the content and its presentation alone. As such, the audience categories help form a broad impression of how a title might work with the announced themes, but offer little to no in-depth information about specific content or its treatment. The audience categories originate from manga magazines, which group titles of a same intended audience into a magazine that is advertised as belonging to that category, and so manga-based anime will have the category from their parent work. As for anime based on other works, the audience is often debatable, but comparing information such as time slot to the manga-based anime generally helps figure out the most likely possibility. If the parent material was classified under multiple audiences over time (for example, it was originally shounen, but then as the plot changed and became more mature, it was reclassified as seinen), and the anime adapts parent material time periods covering multiple audiences, we tag all audiences covered by the anime adaptation.

tag.name: original work
tag.description: What the anime is based on! This is given as the original work credit in the OP. Mostly of academic interest, but a useful bit of info, hinting at the possible depth of story.

tag.name: elements
tag.description: Next to Themes setting the backdrop for the protagonists in anime, there are the more detailed plot Elements that centre on character interactions: "What do characters do to each other or what is done to them?". Is it violent Action, an awe-inspiring Adventure in a foreign place, the gripping life of a Detective, a slapstick Comedy, an Ecchi Harem anime, a SciFi epic, or some Fantasy travelling adventure?

tag.name: manga
tag.description: Manga is the lifeblood that drives the anime industry. Everything and its mother is based on manga. However! There are exceptions where the manga was not the basis for the anime. It`s common practice to make manga adaptations of many popular anime, there`s a manga based on Evangelion, and two (one shounen and one shoujo) based on each of Escaflowne and Mahou Tsukai Tai. Also it`s quite common to release manga and anime versions of a story in parallel, for instance Nadesico and Shoujo Kakumei Utena. There are also cases where an anime continues in a manga, as in the case of Angel Beats! and Angel Beats: Heaven`s Door, or reverse. See also http://anidb.net/t6493 [manhua] and http://anidb.net/t5010 [manhwa].

tag.name: adventure
tag.description: Adventures are exciting stories, with new experiences or exotic locales. Adventures are designed to provide an action-filled, energetic experience for the viewer. Rather than the predominant emphasis on violence and fighting that is found in pure action anime, however, the viewer of adventures can live vicariously through the travels, conquests, explorations, creation of empires, struggles and situations that confront the main characters, actual historical figures or protagonists. Under the category of adventures, we can include traditional swashbucklers, serialized films, and historical spectacles, searches or expeditions for lost continents, "jungle" and "desert" epics, treasure hunts and quests, disaster films, and heroic journeys or searches for the unknown. Adventure films are often, but not always, set in an historical period, and may include adapted stories of historical or literary adventure heroes, kings, battles, rebellion, or piracy.

tag.name: comedy
tag.description: Anime whose central struggle causes hilarious results. These stories are built upon funny characters, situations and events. A comedy anime is laced with humour and sets out to provoke laughter from the audience. Japanese humour can be a bit strange to westerners, so if you`re new to this type of humour, just bear with it; it`ll most likely grow on you if you`re a fan of other kinds of comedy.

episode.title: 奇跡の怪盗[ミラクルメイカー]あらわる!
The Miracle Maker Appears!
Miracle Maker Arawaru
episode.summary: Phantom Thief Joker is the miracle maker who hunts for the world`s treasures! This time, he`s after the Dragon Gem. Joker infiltrates the Kaneari mansion, where he meets rookie burglar Hachi, who`s after the same treasure he is. Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 氷と炎の勇者たち
The Heroes of Ice and Flame
Koori to Honoo no Yuusha-tachi
episode.summary: Joker is after the "Ice Sculpture of Odin", which is on display on the 88th floor of a skyscraper known as the Valhalla Tower. When Joker learns that Spade is after the same treasure, he gets even more determined, saying, "I can`t lose to him of all people!" Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 人魚[マーメイド]と偽りの船
The Mermaid and the Ship of Fakes
Mermaid to Itsuwari no Fune
episode.summary: Joker and Hachi infiltrate Kaneari`s private luxury liner to steal the "Mermaid`s Crystal" on board. There, the mysterious Phantom Thief Spade and Joker`s old training partner, King appear. Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 芸術の都[パリ]と百年金庫
Paris and the 100-Year Safe
Paris to Hyakunen Kinko
episode.summary: Joker and Hachi (now officially Joker`s apprentice) have decided their next target will be the "Recollection of Napoleon". The treasure is hidden within the 100-year safe, which opens only once every century. Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: ダイヤモンドと涙の女王[クイーン]・前編
The Diamond and the Queen of Tears: Part 1
Diamond to Namida no Queen: Zenpen
episode.summary: The treasures Joker goes after are being destroyed one after another. Joker and Hachi are afraid that their next target, the Silver Egg of the Russian Tsar, might be destroyed as well, so decide to try to beat the culprit to the punch. Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 真紅の邪神島
The Island of the Evil Scarlet God
Shinku no Jashintou
episode.summary: Blue sea! White clouds! A tropical island! Joker and Hachi are after a gem called the Scarlet Heart, which legends say once belonged to the island`s great king. There`s an old stone tablet in the village wiith a riddle that will lead to the treasure. Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 影[シャドウ]は舞い降りた
The Shadow Descends
Shadow wa Maiorita
episode.summary: The news reports that Joker as been performing brutal, forceful robberies at art museums all over the world. Joker doesn`t remember doing any of this, and attempts to head off his impostor, who seeks to steal the Gemini Crown, at the Moonlight Grand Hotel. Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 輝く夜への旅立ち
Journey into the Shining Night
Kagayaku Yoru e no Tabidachi
episode.summary: While cleaning Joker`s room, Hachi discovers a mysterious key. Joker relives a memory of his childhood, when his father challenged him to a game of riddles over that key. Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 激突! 闇の忍者軍団
Crash! The Dark Ninja Army
Gekitotsu! Yami no Ninja Gundan
episode.summary: Joker and Hachi sneak into the castle of the Koga Ninja to steal the Golden Shachihoko from the roof of their great hall. Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 満月に吠える獣
The Beast That Howls at the Moon
Mangetsu ni Hoeru Kemono
episode.summary: As children, Joker, Spade, and Queen saved an injured dog. They named him "Roko" after his love of corn (tomorokoshi). It turns out Roko is actually Super Dog #101, created in a laboratory, and can speak human language. Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 華麗なる黄金特急
The Luxurious Kaneari Golden Express
Karei Naru Kogane Tokkyuu
episode.summary: Joker and Hachi sneak on board Mr. Kaneari`s private Golden Express, a non-stop special express meant to transport a historical family treasure to the Kaneari Museum in Paris. Joker and Hachi sneak into the train from the roof, then infiltrate the sleeper car in disguise, but they end up trapped by iron bars in one car. Joker makes it out of the trap and tries to swipe the car itself by detaching it at the switchover point, but... Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: ダイヤモンドと涙の女王[クイーン]・後編
The Queen of Diamonds and Tears: Part 2
Diamond to Namida no Queen: Kouhen
episode.summary: Oniyama and his team used the fake Silver Egg to fool the thieves while they loaded the real one onto a plane. Queen disguises herself as a passenger to get on board and destroy the Silver Egg. Meanwhile, the injured Silver Heart tells Joker that Queen has mistaken him for the man who killed her parents, and asks him to clear up the misunderstanding. Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 鏡と影の迷宮[ラビリンス]
The Labyrinth of Shadows and Mirrors
Kagami to Kage no Labyrinth
episode.summary: A series of underground Grecian ruins plays host to the "Treasure of Olympus." Hachi and Roko are forced to charge into the ruins after Spade to keep him from beating them to the treasure. Source: crunchyroll
